overview:
Luis Stevens is a revered pioneer in hypercomputing with extensive expertise in data modeling, semantic analysis and supercomputing. He holds 18 patents and has served strategic technology leadership roles with several of the leading organizations, including Silicon Graphics, Intel and IBM. He’s also built solutions which have becomes technological backbones for organizations like NASA and the NSA.

Currently, Luis is Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer of AKUDA LABS, a private strategic operation commissioned to revolutionizing real-time, big streaming data filtering, classification and analytics, making it more accessible and affordable than ever before. Under Luis’ leadership AKUDA LABS has assembled a world-class technology development team with extensive private industry, public sector and academic research experience, which is surpassing hypercomputing barriers tat a rate never seen before.

AKUDA LABS Pulsar hypercomputing platform is the fastest, most efficient real-time stream classification engine available. This pioneering system currently processes 500 million Streaming Classification Operations Per Second (SCOPS) on a path to 1+ billion SCOPS. AKUDA LABSâ€™ Pulsar transforms big, fast, ugly data into real-time, actionable insight at exponential speed and fractional cost compared to general-purpose solutions.
